definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: The particular effect of the painting brushwork is the exploration of the impressionists towards the format language.
sentences.chinese: 獨特的筆法效果是印象派畫家對形式語言的探索。

sentences.english: Bright colours and bold strokes characterize his early paintings.
sentences.chinese: 他早期繪畫的特點是色彩鮮明，筆法粗獷。

sentences.english: The method of painting lies yet in the "eight fundamental strokes of writing."
sentences.chinese: 繪畫的筆法，其基本且肇端於書法的“永”字八法。

sentences.english: The brushwork suggests movement and the passing of time.
sentences.chinese: 筆法表明運動和時間的推移。

sentences.english: The technique of writing includes two aspects of holding and wielding brush writings.
sentences.chinese: 筆法包括執筆和運筆兩個方面。
畢加索的筆法精妙絕倫。

sentences.english: Artists with a variety of colors, abstract strokes depicting the scene of this winter.
sentences.chinese: 畫家用多樣的色彩，抽象的筆法描畫了這幅冬日景象。

definition: to suggest (rather than depict in detail)/freehand style of Chinese painting, characterized by bold strokes rather than accurate details
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
